steps.title: Understand the Purpose of dircolors Command

verify.name: Verify dircolors command output
verify.hint: The `dircolors --print-database` command should display the current color settings, including the "NORMAL 00" line.

verify.name: Verify custom dircolors configuration
verify.hint: The custom dircolors configuration file should contain the "DIR 01;32" line, and the "ls -l" command should display the directory in bold green.

verify.name: Verify custom dircolors configuration file
verify.hint: The custom dircolors configuration file should exist at ~/.dircolors and contain the "DIR 01;32" line.

verify.name: Verify dircolors configuration is applied
verify.hint: The "ls -l" command should display the directory in bold green, indicating that the custom dircolors configuration is being used.
